housing_price package¶

Submodules¶

housing_price.ingest_data module¶

housing_price.ingest_data.driver_data()[source]¶

Driver code to perform below mentioned tasks

  1. Download and extract raw housing dataset

  2. Splitting the dataset into test and train and saves them

housing_price.ingest_data.fetch_extract_housing_data(housing_url='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ageron/handson-ml/master/datasets/housing/housing.tgz', housing_path='data')[source]¶

Fetches and extracts data from the given url.

Parameters:

  • housing_url (str) – URL of raw dataset

  • housing_path (str) – Root folder of the extracted dataset

Returns:

Extracts the housing dataset

Return type:

None

housing_price.ingest_data.initialize_parser()[source]¶

Parses command-line arguments so they can used in the code.

housing_price.ingest_data.load_housing_data(housing_path='data')[source]¶

Loads the dataset.

Parameters:

housing_path (str) – Path of the dataset to load

Returns:

Returns the housing dataframe

Return type:

Dataframe

housing_price.ingest_data.split_dataset(df)[source]¶

Splitting the passed dataframe into test and train by maintaining proportionate ranges of target feature in them.

Parameters:

df (Dataframe) – Housing dataframe with derived columns included

Returns:

Returns train and test array respectively

Return type:

array(s)

housing_price.logger_functions module¶

housing_price.logger_functions.configure_logger(logger=None, cfg=None, log_file=None, console=True, log_level='DEBUG')[source]¶

Function to setup configurations of logger through function.

The individual arguments of log_file, console, log_level will overwrite the ones in cfg.

Parameters:

  • logger – Predefined logger object if present. If None a ew logger object will be created from root.

  • cfg (dict()) – Configuration of the logging to be implemented by default

  • log_file (str) – Path to the log file for logs to be stored

  • console (bool) – To include a console handler(logs printing in console)

  • log_level (str) – One of [“INFO”,”DEBUG”,”WARNING”,”ERROR”,”CRITICAL”] default - “DEBUG”

Return type:

logging.Logger

housing_price.score module¶

housing_price.score.driver_score()[source]¶

Driver code to run the score script

  1. Reads the train and test datasets

  2. Transform the datasets using saved transformer

  3. Create metrics dataframe for test and train transformed datasets for differerent metrics (‘mse’, ‘rmse’, ‘mae’)

housing_price.score.initialize_parser()[source]¶

Parses command-line arguments so they can used in the code.

housing_price.train module¶

class housing_price.train.CombinedAttributesAdder(add_bedrooms_per_room=True, cols_to_index_mapper={'bedrooms': 4, 'households': 6, 'population': 5, 'rooms': 3})[source]¶

Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

Custom Transformer to create derived columns rooms_per_household, bedrooms_per_room, population_per_household.

Parameters:

  • add_bedrooms_per_room (Bool) – Flag whether to add bedrooms_per_room to the array.

  • cols_to_index_mapper (Dict) – key-value pair where keys are columns and values are it’s indexes.

fit(X, y=None)[source]¶

Fit the transformer.

Parameters:

  • X (array) – Input array passed

  • y (array) – Input target array

transform(X)[source]¶

Transforms the data.

Parameters:

X (array) – Data to transform.

Returns:

Returns transformed array with added derived columns

Return type:

Array

housing_price.train.create_metrics_df(models, X, y)[source]¶

Creates a metrics dataframe for all some algorithms

Parameters:

  • models (list of str) – List of models. Accepted strings: “lr”, “dt”, “rf”. Ignores remaining provided strings.

  • X (array) – Transformed feature array

  • y (array) – target array

Return type:

None

housing_price.train.df_X_y(df, target)[source]¶

Converts the input dataframe into feature dataframe and target array based on target column name.

Parameters:

  • df (Dataframe) – Dataframe to be divided

  • target (str) – Name of the target column in the dataframe

Returns:

Returns the divided feature dataframe and target array

Return type:

Dataframe, array

housing_price.train.driver_train()[source]¶

Driver code to run the train script

  1. Creates feature engineered dataframe and saves the feature transformer

  2. Run gridsearch on an estimator to get best model parameters and saves that model.

housing_price.train.feature_engineering(X, y, output_folder='artifacts')[source]¶

Transforms feature dataframe

  1. Converts categorical columns into dummy variables

  2. Imputes missing values in numerical columns

  3. Adds some derived numerical columns using custom transformer class.

  4. Scales the numerical columns.

and saves the feature transformer in output_folder.

Parameters:

  • X (Dataframe) – Feature Dataframe

  • y (Array) – Target array

  • output_folder (str) – Path to save the feature transformer

Returns:

Returns transformed dataframe

Return type:

Dataframe

housing_price.train.initialize_parser()[source]¶

Parses command-line arguments so they can used in the code.
